title.narrative: Forum Syd: Increasing Democractic Process and Rights for Sustain. NRM 2014-2016
Forum Syd: Increasing Democratic Process and Rights for Sustain. NRM 2014-2016

description.narrative: Just and sustainable society in Cambodia where poor and marginalised women and men have the ability and confidence to challenge existing power imbalances related to access, use and control of natural resources, so that they can fully claim and realise their rights equally.

The overall impacts goal is to help Cambodia achieving '' a just and sustainable society where poor and margionalized communities have the ability and confidence to challenge existing power imbalances related to access, use and control of natural resources, so that they can fully claim and realize their rights''. The programme is focusing on the thematic areas based on the appl. Rights-Based Approach.

The overall impacts goal is to help Cambodia achieving '' a just and sustainable society where poor and margionalized communities have the ability and confidence to challenge existing power imbalances related to access, use and control of natural resources, so that they can fully claim and realize their rights''. The programme is focusing on the thematic areas based on the appl. Rights-Based Approach.

tag.narrative: 13.1 - Strengthen resilience and adaptive capacity to climate-related hazards and natural disasters in all countries.
13.1 - Stärka motståndskraften mot och förmågan till anpassning till klimatrelaterade faror och naturkatastrofer i alla länder.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2016Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: During the programme implementation, Forum Syd and its 20 partners worked with a total of 435 Community based organisations, including 130 Communal Land Titling/Indigenous People Organizations/Communities, 111 Community Forestry Organizations/ Community Protected Areas and 194 Community Fisheries and youth networks in over 1,193 target villages, 329 communes, and 174 districts in 23 provinces/municipality. Of the community based organizations, 271 (62%) were recognized/registered. Nearly 400 community plans were integrated into Commune Investment and Commune Development Plans, and grants were provided to 81 community based organization projects. Small grants were also provided to eight advocacy groups. Among the many activities and their outputs, Forum Syd and partners conducted a number of community workshops resulting in community actions plans. There were also innovative gender trainings, capacity building to strengthen the 20 partner organizations and 435 community based organizations, and various outreach to local, subnational and national authorities to inform and educate. The outputs and outcomes include community based groups and indigenous groups acquiring rights to their local land and being able to keep poachers from fishing in their sunken forests. It also includes women taking on leadership roles in commune councils as well as the community based organizations. And, duty bearers became better informed and willing to engage with partner organizations and community based organizations, not just in conversation but in direct action to turn the tide of deforestation and further climate change. Forum Syd also collected valuable learning experiences throughout the three years, which provided the program with best practices for the entirety of implementation. Parallel to these efforts, Forum Syd engaged with authorities at the national level in order to have an ongoing dialogue and to reduce tensions. This had tangible results such as MOUs with government ministries that de facto allowed the partner organizations and community based organizations to continue to operate and carry out their work under the program.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
